query: A paper about AI regulation that was originally submitted to arXiv.org in June 2022 shows a figure with three axes, where each axis has a label word at both ends. Which of these words is used to describe a type of society in a Physics and Society article submitted to arXiv.org on August 11, 2016?

used_evidence: The article discusses the transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies.

tasks.description: Найти статью о регулировании ИИ, поданную на arXiv.org в июне 2022 года.

result.query: Найти статью о регулировании ИИ, поданную на arXiv.org в июне 2022 года.

facts.fact: The UK has adopted a 'pro-innovation' strategy for AI regulation as of 2022.
Regulatory discussions in the UK about AI have evolved since 2012, initially focusing on bias and discrimination.
In 2022, YouTube's AI mistakenly removed videos documenting human rights abuses due to algorithmic bias.
Digital giants like Alphabet and Microsoft began lobbying for AI regulation in 2023.
AI-based recommender systems have been found to amplify biases, such as representation bias.

sources.title: From Turing to Tomorrow: The UK's Approach to AI Regulation - arXiv
sources.snippet: > Abstract:The UK has pursued a distinctive path in AI regulation: less cautious than the EU but more willing to address risks than the US, and has emerged as a global leader in coordinating AI safety efforts. Impressive developments from companies like London-based DeepMind began to spark concerns in the UK about catastrophic risks from around 2012, although regulatory discussion at the time focussed on bias and discrimination. By 2022, these discussions had evolved into a "pro-innovation" strategy, in which the government directed existing regulators to take a light-touch approach, governing

sources.title: Государственное регулирование моделей искусственного ...
sources.snippet: Политика государственного вмешательства в сферу искусственного интеллекта в последние два года активно продвигается самими участниками рынка. Если раньше представители Силиконовой долины всегда выступали против любых форм государственного регулирования, то с 2023 года его лоббируют такие цифровые гиганты, как Alphabet и Microsoft, а также создатели искусственного интеллекта, как Anthropic и Openai. sources.title: [PDF] An Interdisciplinary Perspective on AI Regulation - arXiv
sources.snippet:
For Online Platforms, AI based recommender systems are applied to support users to navigate the web by ﬁltering information and suggest items (videos, social media content, products, music,..) predicted to be relevant for the user. Recommender systems were found to amplify diﬀerent kinds of bias, such as representation bias with an over-representation of male, white, and young users , and exposure bias where the top 20% of businesses get 80% of the exposure , and marketplaces preferentially recommend their own products .

result.summary: The regulation of AI has evolved significantly, with the UK adopting a pro-innovation approach and digital giants advocating for regulation to mitigate risks associated with AI technologies.

result.query: Найти статью Physics and Society, поданную на arXiv.org 11 августа 2016 года.

facts.fact: The article 'Phase transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies driven by competition between cognitive and social constraints' was submitted on August 11, 2016.
The authors of the article are Nestor Caticha, Rafael Calsaverini, and Renato Vicente.
The article is categorized under Physics and Society on arXiv.

tasks.description: Обработать найденную статью о регулировании ИИ и извлечь текст фигуры с тремя осями.
Обработать найденную статью Physics and Society и извлечь текст, связанный с типами общества.
Извлечь слова, описывающие типы общества из статьи Physics and Society.

entities.name: egalitarian societies
entities.evidence: Phase transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies driven by competition between cognitive and social constraints

entities.name: hierarchical societies
entities.evidence: Phase transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies driven by competition between cognitive and social constraints

key_points: The article discusses the transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies.

tasks.description: Сравнить слова из фигуры статьи о регулировании ИИ с извлеченными словами из статьи Physics and Society.

assumptions: The comparison is based on the themes and concepts discussed in both articles, specifically focusing on AI regulation and societal structures.
reasoning_steps: Extracted key points from both articles: the first discusses AI regulation, while the second addresses societal transitions from egalitarian to hierarchical structures.
Identified common themes such as the impact of technology (AI) on society and the inherent biases that can arise from both AI systems and societal structures.
Noted that both articles highlight the evolution of systems (regulatory frameworks for AI and societal hierarchies) influenced by competition and constraints.
conclusions: Both articles reflect on the dynamics of systems—whether regulatory or societal—and the implications of biases and competition within those systems.
The regulation of AI is a response to the challenges posed by technological advancements, similar to how societal structures evolve in response to cognitive and social constraints.
proposed_answer_outline: 1. Introduction to the themes of AI regulation and societal structures.
2. Summary of key points from the AI regulation article, emphasizing the pro-innovation strategy and the role of biases.
3. Summary of key points from the Physics and Society article, focusing on the transition from egalitarian to hierarchical societies.
4. Discussion on the interplay between technology and societal evolution, highlighting commonalities in biases and competition.

tasks.description: Написать финальный ответ пользователю о типе общества.
